single_event.message: 50-year-old Mohammad Akhlaq and his 22-year-old son, Danish, are beaten up by a mob for after an announcement is made from a local temple accusing them of consuming beef for Eid and storing it for later consumption.
Communal tension grips Dadri. Temple priest and his assistant are arrested. They claim the announcement was made by ten people including the local BJP leader’s son.
Corporal Mohammad Sartaj, Akhlaq’s son, appeals for peace and moves his family out of Dadri. Akhilesh Yadav, chief minister of Uttar Pradesh, announces compensation of Rs 10 lakh to Akhlaq’s family.
Eight arrested for Akhlaq’s lynching.
Mahesh Sharma, local MP and Union minister of state for culture and tourism, visits Akhlaq’s family, says, the lynching was an accident and not planned.
Media is attacked in Dadri
Akhilesh Yadav, the then chief minister of Uttar Pradesh, raises compensation to Akhlaq’s family to Rs 30 lakh.
Sangeet Som, BJP MLA, warns of a Hindu backlash if innocent boys are framed.
Nayantara Seghal, author, returns her Sahitya Akademi Award, Ashok Vajpeyi and Rheman Abbas also return awards.
Yogi Adityanath’s Hindu Yuva Vahini offers guns to Hindus in Dadri.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi says, “Hindus and Muslims should fight poverty and not each other.”
Akhlaq’s family moved to Air Force accommodation in Delhi
NHRC terms Akhlaq’s lynching a serious violation of human rights
Modi terms the incident saddening and questions the logic of blaming the centre for the lynching.
Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said Thursday “Muslims can continue to live in this country, but they will have to give up eating beef” because “the cow is an article of faith here”.
Panchjanya, RSS mouthpiece, defends Dadri lynching, claims Vedas order killing of sinners who kill cow
National Minorities Commission claims the lynching was pre meditated.

UP Police files chargesheet against 15 including a minor for Akhlaq’s lynching under Sections 147 (rioting), 148 (rioting with deadly weapon), 149 (unlawful assembly), 302 (murder), 307 (attempt to murder), 458 (house-breaking), and 504 (intentional insult with intent to breach of the peace) of the Indian Penal Code. Two among the 15 are related to local BJP leaders.
Uttar Pradesh Veterinary department claims the meat was mutton not beef
Mathura forensics labs suggest the meat was beef.

Bisara resident Suraj Pal submitted a plea in a local court, seeking orders for police to register an FIR against Akhlaq and his family members on charges relating to cow slaughter and animal cruelty. On June 15, the court directed Jharcha police to file an FIR, under section 156 (3) of CrPC, against Akhlaq and his family members.

Judicial magistrate Vijay Kumar at the Surajpur district court on Thursday directed UP police to file an FIR under section 156 (3). The petitioner, Surajpal, had based his plea on a report by a forensic lab in Mathura that a meat sample taken from the site of the attack belonged to “a cow or its progeny”.
Two accused in the case granted bail by Allahabad High Court.

mandatory_config.timeline_description: Nelson Mandela, the revolutionary-turned-prisoner-turned-president who led South Africa out of apartheid and into an era of political and racial reconciliation, passed away on Dec. 5, 2013. He was 95. As both the father of his nation and its conscience, Mandela’s remarkable life changed history and its legacy resonates around the world.
